Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Locomotion \Lo`co*mo"tion\, n. [L. locus place + motio motion: cf. F. locomotion. See {Local}, and {Motion}.] 1. The act of moving from place to place. `` Animal locomotion.'' --Milton. [1913 Webster]
2. The power of moving from place to place, characteristic of the higher animals and some of the lower forms of plant life. [1913 Webster]
3. The name of a song and a dance, briefly popular in the 1960's; as, do the locomotion. [PJC]
locomotion n 1: the power or ability to move [syn: {motive power}, {motivity}] 2: self-propelled movement [syn: {travel}]
